subject: Science
title: Iron: Blood and Steel
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Iron: Blood and Steel.

hook.text: Iron makes your blood red and your buildings strong. It's the most used metal on Earth.

buildup.text: Iron atoms sit at the center of hemoglobin, binding oxygen in your red blood cells.

discovery.text: Iron is also the most stable element. Stars stop fusing atoms when they reach iron.

twist.text: Iron rusts when exposed to water and oxygen ‚Äî forming iron oxide, which is weaker.

climax.text: Stainless steel adds chromium to iron, creating a protective layer that resists rust.

punchline.text: Iron carries your oxygen and holds up your buildings. One element, two critical jobs.
